author: wolfram.blockchain.labs
title: Research Exploration in DeFi
description: Los desarrolladores necesitan investigación financiera y herramientas que les ayuden a descubrir y crear modelos DeFi innovadores.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is quite empty. There is not enough information which can be used as a based layer to rate its impact. I suggest to the proposer to look at funded proposals as reference in order to better structure this proposal. The problem identified can be considered as good and can fit into the challenge. However there is a serious need to improve this proposal, for instance, by articulating how it adds value to the cardano ecosystem, add key metrics and strong KPIs and all the other details that can be useful to the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: There is not enough information in this proposal to be feasible. The proposer should add evidence of the skills and experience claimed in this proposal. The proposer can extend the proposal improvement by adding a budget breakdown section, a timetable to complete the work, a clear description of what is being built and how.  Once all these areas are filled, I think that the proposal can have a chance of being approved in future funds.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal lacks the basic information required to be auditable. The proposer should add a roadmap with realistic milestones , Metrics and KPIs and a clear description of the product being built and the problem it solves. The best way, in my opinion, to get help for structuring the proposal is to head over the funded proposal and emulate them.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is very comprehensive and according to the team seems to be aimed at lending help to the Cardano projects that have reached out to Wolfram Blockchain Labs for assistance and they as a company involved with Cardano would like to be able to assist those teams through catalyst funding.

I believe their approach to systems levels thinking applied to blockchain so help shift defi from mainly a speculative asset that can earn a return, into real world financial products that can improve the conditions of society.
f6_assessments.q1: Given the team behind this proposal, combined with the roadmap and key people behind this proposal after browsing through their qualifications on linkedin I think this team is the right one's to deliver a completed proposal as written!
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap appears comprehensive, with detailed milestones and reasonable and sensible KPIs. I also believe these milestones to fit well within the defined scope of this proposal and understand that given it's a research focused proposal it will be done alongside a longer time horizon, and we will have plenty of time to audit the relative success of this proposal, if funded successfully.

f6_assessments.q0:
This project offers blockchain financial services that can support real-side economic activity that can assist developers in the discovery and creation of innovative Defi models. But the proposer lacks info to show how this project impacts the development of the Cardano ecosystem, there is also no info that directly relates to the Cardano network.
The proposer provides key measurements for this project that might align with the challenge setting.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer share detailed research about the problem and the solution can solve, but most of the detail is about the environment, technology... it's lacking an implementation plan that can help people to know which work in detail they will solve. Inside the proposal, the proposer includes key objectives and a short roadmap to help figure out which group of tasks this project will bring to, but my advice is he should give more info to help CA/ vCA assess the feasibility better. 
About the budget, the proposer also just allocates but categorizes by fields. My advice is that they should break down the team cost into positions or scope of works. 
The proposer also provides a list of members with info in the proposal and I think that these experts can help to make this project.
f6_assessments.q2:
It really hard to audit this project with just outlined content in the proposal. My advice for the proposer is that break down more detail in the roadmap, maybe into marketing activities, coding activities... in every period. That will help Catalyst team audit this project easier. Moreover, the proposer should bring their key objectives into the timeline and add more KPIs/ key metrics. Hence, CA and vCA can identify which goal this project plans to get and track. 
The good thing in this proposal is the detailed explanation of the problem, it shows that the proposer has dived much in it. Therefore, their solution detail is convincible and clear for people to get where their goal is.

f6_assessments.q0: Excellent proposal from "Wolfram Research" renowned research team. The proposal would clearly have an impact on the Cardano ecosystem, huge resources are necessary to investigate. Try to fix a problem, namely: possible DeFi applications.
f6_assessments.q1: The proponent provides a URL with a detailed project plan. Provides verifiable information on the work team (with access to linkedin of team members)
f6_assessments.q2:
In the website provided, he explains in detail his work plan with key objectives, the execution phases and the budget allocation, it disaggregates the destination of the requested funds, which makes it audited.
It is difficult to analyze the success of the proposal since mere scientific research can be considered successful and necessary.
I am eager to read the results of these wolfram investigations.

solution: Investigación financiera y técnica estructurada sobre las innovaciones de DeFi que aprovechan los atributos únicos de Cardano.
experience: Tenemos miembros del equipo que trabajan activamente en las finanzas comunitarias que pueden ser transferidos a los servicios de blockchain.
